etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin theatrum, from Greek theatron, from theasthai ‘behold’

definitions: a building or outdoor area in which plays and other dramatic performances are given.
shortDefinitions: building or outdoor area in which plays and other dramatic performances are given

definitions: the activity or profession of acting in, producing, directing, or writing plays

examples.text: what made you want to go into the theater?

shortDefinitions: activity or profession of acting in, producing, directing, or writing plays

definitions: a play or other activity or presentation considered in terms of its dramatic quality

examples.text: this is intense, moving, and inspiring theater

shortDefinitions: play or other activity or presentation considered in terms of its dramatic quality

definitions: a room or hall for lectures, etc., with seats in tiers.
shortDefinitions: room or hall for lectures, etc., with seats in tiers

definitions: the area in which something happens

examples.text: a new theater of war has been opened up

definitions: denoting weapons for use in a particular region between tactical and strategic

examples.text: he was working on theater defense missiles

shortDefinitions: denoting weapons for use in particular region between tactical and strategic
